summary: This bill, the Federal Lands Amplified Security for the Homeland Act (FLASH Act), addresses issues on federal lands along the southern border. It focuses on border security enhancement through road construction, U.S. Customs and Border Protection access, and placement of temporary structures by states. The bill also aims to reduce environmental damage by addressing trash accumulation, illegal cannabis cultivation, and wildfires. It further prohibits migrant housing on federal lands and includes stipulations on penalties, reporting, and interagency cooperation.
